text:
As I'm betting larger and larger sizes in the greyhound market- I'm just getting to the point where I'm only being filled on around 65% of the size I want to. 

This will continuously fall - what can I realistically do here? I'm sure many people have been in the same boat so just wondered what you guys would do.

I hope the answer isn't just - move on to horses... but I fear it might be

elements.text: Is this in play or pre race ?

elements.text: Pre race- unfortuantlrt the greyhounds don't have in play betting

text: Couple of obvious things, liquidity increase a lot as you get close to the race so try betting closer to the off. Try breaking your bets up into smaller pieces. or lose some ev and get matched for more and a shorter price. It's all about finding the sweet spot between ev and amount you can get matched for

elements.text: Couple of obvious things, liquidity increase a lot as you get close to the race so try betting closer to the off. Try breaking your bets up into smaller pieces. or lose some ev and get matched for more and a shorter price. It's all about finding the sweet spot between ev and amount you can get matched for

text: I think the main issue, not just for cricket, is Betfair's inability to use the widely accepted team or players names.

elements.text: I think the main issue, not just for cricket, is Betfair's inability to use the widely accepted team or players names.

text:
Agree breaking up into smaller pieces might encourage the market to refill after fills

Making would be another way to encourage greater capacity

text: Gb market. Sizes vary - depends on edge. As low as  min bet (if odds are large). For shorter odds the bet size can me very large >£1k

elements.text: Gb market. Sizes vary - depends on edge. As low as  min bet (if odds are large). For shorter odds the bet size can me very large >£1k

text: Yeah, that’s probably quite large. I think getting £1k on could be tough, given average market matches like 10k or smth. So I would definitely try and space that out over time at least.

elements.text: Yeah, that’s probably quite large. I think getting £1k on could be tough, given average market matches like 10k or smth. So I would definitely try and space that out over time at least.

text:
Just to clarify - my average bet size is way smaller. There have been on occasion with very short odds combined with a large edge where a large lay bet made profitable and bankroll sense. 

But yes average sizes are way lower. I've been running strategies since Janaury 2023. I had a pretty good 2023... 2024 has naaaaat been good for me!
